page.title: 11CHANGES IN VILLAGE LIFE
page.content:
We asked some of the inhabitants who have lived here for thirty to forty years how the village has changed. The village has seen more changes in the last ten years than in any other decade. There are many more people and the community is now mixed, though many think it is still an agricultural village. Many new houses have been built and many are proposed. There are six new building sites some about to start and some in full swing. The pubs have declined in number. The village is noisier now due to trainees' aircraft and the vehicles which pass through or belong to the village.
Researched by Pamela, Julie, James and Simon.
